text: Cabinet plotters want Lidington to take over temporarily before full leadership campaign in autumn. Can think of many potential flaws with this plan. No1: cabinet completely divided on Brexit.

text: Japan dates given by Imperial era: 2019 is 31st year of Heisei, but on May 1 date changes to new era. Characters for Heisei on financial documents and built into computer systems that did not exist in 1989, last change of Imperial era.

text: York's employment rate is above average and has risen slightly, but much less rapidly than UK as a whole. May be because of planning constraints on housing growth.
author: GroomB

text: Place that has really tumbled is York, down from 116.3% of UK GVA in 2003 to 92.6% in 2017. Leeds's drop has been less steep.
author: GroomB

text: Why has Yorkshire and Humber economy done so badly since financial crisis? Unemployment now UK's highest at 5.2%. Output has grown at less than half national pace, skill qualifications and productivity below average.
author: GroomB

text: UK's 3.9% jobless rate compares with France 8.8%, Germany 3.2%, Spain 14.1%, Greece 18.5%, eurozone 7.8%, Canada 5.8%, Japan 2.5%, US 3.8%.
author: GroomB

text: Jobless rate highest in Yorks and Humber at 5.2%, followed by North East and West Midlands 5.1%. Lowest South West 2.9%, followed by South East 3.1%.
author: GroomB

text: UK jobs growth continues to defy slowdown. Employment rate reaches record 76.1%. Hiring at fastest pace for three years.
